sentences: Christian Joseph Morata Bautista (born October 19, 1981) is a Filipino singer, actor, host, and model.
section: N/A

sentences: He was a finalist of Star in a Million, a Philippine reality show aired on ABS-CBN channel, winning 4th place in the competition in 2003.
section: N/A

sentences: After the contest, he signed a recording contract with Warner Music Philippines and released his self-titled debut album, Christian Bautista.
section: N/A

sentences: The multi-platinum album established his name as an OPM artist with songs such as "The Way You Look at Me", "Colour Everywhere" and "Hands to Heaven".
section: N/A

sentences: The singer gained popularity not only in the Philippines but in other countries in Southeast Asia such as Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand.
section: N/A

sentences: Bautista has also collaborated with fellow Filipino singers Nina, Sitti, Rachelle Ann Go, Sarah Geronimo, Sheryn Regis, Erik Santos and Mark Bautista.
section: N/A

sentences: He regularly appears in ABS-CBN's variety show ASAP 18.
section: N/A

sentences: Bautista shot The Kitchen Musical with fellow Stages talent Karylle and other Asian and Filipino talents in Singapore.
section: N/A

sentences: After being with ABS-CBN for 10 years, Bautista transferred to GMA Network and signed a three-year exclusive contract on March 20, 2013.
section: N/A

sentences: Bautista was born in Imus, Cavite, on October 19, 1981.

sentences: He is the eldest of three siblings, sons of Josefa Rizalina and Ebert Bautista.

sentences: He was a choir member in their church since he was seven years old.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Bautista studied grade school and high school at Imus Unida Christian School, which also hailed other Filipino actors such as Ryan Eigenmann, Geoff Eigenmann, Rico Yan and Billy Joe Crawford.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: He then took up landscape architecture at the University of the Philippines Diliman, graduating with a Bachelor of Arts degree.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Bautista gained popularity after becoming the first grand finalist on ABS-CBN's reality singing competition Star in a Million.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2003–2004: Star in a Million and self-titled album ===

sentences: Though placing only fourth overall, he quickly become one of the most popular contestants, and was offered a recording contract with Warner Music Philippines shortly after he was eliminated from the show.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2003–2004: Star in a Million and self-titled album ===

sentences: He released the single "The Way You Look at Me", in 2004 from his self-titled album.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2003–2004: Star in a Million and self-titled album ===

sentences: The song, penned by American composers Andrew Fromm and Keith Follese, received frequent airplay in Indonesian radio stations and Bautista became an instant hit overseas that record label Warner Indonesia decided to bring him there to perform for his growing Indonesian fanbase.

== Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: Completely ===
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: Completely, Christian Bautista's second album, received a Platinum Record Award on its first week of release in the Philippines.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: The album spawned the singles "Everything You Do", "Invincible", and "She Could Be", a song which was later covered by Corbin Bleu of High School Musical fame.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: Completely has also reached platinum status in Indonesia.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: A special edition of the album Completely, which combines Christian's English songs from his debut and second albums, was later launched in Singapore where "The Way You Look at Me" also topped local charts.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: In 2005, RCTI aired a musical special entitled Completely: Christian Bautista where he performed with Indonesian artists 40-piece Magenta Orchestra, Andi Rianto, Krisdayanti and Titi DJ.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: In the same year, Bautista was cast as one of the leads in Kampanerang Kuba, a musical fantasy television series broadcast by ABS-CBN.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: Banking on his massive following among young fans in Indonesia, Bautista has been tapped by San Miguel Corporation to endorse its new line of soft beverage products in the Asian region, starting with Indonesia.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: Christian also endorses a new mobile content provider based in Jakarta called Star SMS, and soon for Oishi food products in the Philippines, and Indonesia.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2005: Completely ===

sentences: Locally, he has been the face for Bench clothing and body spray, St. Augustine School of Nursing, Smart telecommunications, Trumpets Musicademy, Bed Head products, Skechers, and Swatch watches.
